column4: I pasted a backup of xorg.conf a long time ago... How do I find it?
I had it set to 1 month
and it hasnt been 1 month
hi!
check /etc/X11/
Sorry, I meant to say "to pastebin"
you need to know your number
Darn, thanks
restart the livecd
I mentioned Live CD because that's where the defaults come from.
if you install then all the defaults are installed too
I don't want to reinstall because I want all of my files.
you want to default back, each application works different
apps mostly revert back to default if you delete their .hiddenfolder in your home
Do you know how to revert to default of Ubuntu's video drivers and setup only?
sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
For me, all that does is setup the keyboard stuff...
sudo nvidia-settings if you have a nvidia card
cheap mice tend to move in short bursts on their own.
Uhmm... It's the same mouse that I've used for months... and it works in Windows
I was just suggesting that's what cheap mice do, had loads that do that.
Okay.. I'll restart
To let you know: restarting the GDM didn't work... so I restarted the computer and it worked.
